name: zero_add
statement: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
proof:
theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
  induction n with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ, ih]

name: succ_add
statement: theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b)  := by
proof:
theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b) := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero]
    rw [add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ]
    rw [add_succ]
    rw [ih]
known_theorems: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by

name: add_comm
statement: theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
proof:
theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b) := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ, add_succ, ih]

theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
  induction a with
  | zero =>
    rw [zero_add, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [succ_add, add_succ, ih]

  induction c with

name: two_plus_two_ne_five
statement: theorem two_plus_two_ne_five : add (succ (succ zero)) (succ (succ zero)) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := by
proof:
theorem two_plus_two_ne_five : add (succ (succ zero)) (succ (succ zero)) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := by
  -- Compute `add two two` step by step
  rw [two_eq_succ_one]
  rw [add_succ]
  rw [one_eq_succ_zero]
  rw [add_succ]
  rw [add_zero]
  -- Now we have `succ (succ (succ (succ zero))) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero))))`
  -- Simplify to `four ≠ five`
  rw [four_eq_succ_three]
  intro h
  -- Apply `succ_inj` repeatedly to reduce the inequality
  apply zero_ne_one
  apply succ_inj at h
  apply succ_inj at h
  exact h

statement: theorem succ_mul (a b : MyNat) : mul (succ a) b = add (mul a b) b := by
proof:
theorem succ_mul (a b : MyNat) : mul (succ a) b = add (mul a b) b := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero, mul_zero, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ, mul_succ, ih]

name: add_sq
statement: theorem add_sq (a b : MyNat) : pow (add a b) two = add (add (pow a two) (pow b two)) (mul (mul two a) b) := by
proof:
theorem add_sq (a b : MyNat) : pow (add a b) two = add (add (pow a two) (pow b two)) (mul (mul two a) b) := by
  rw [pow_two] -- pow (add a b) two = mul (add a b) (add a b)
  rw [mul_add] -- mul (add a b) (add a b) = add (mul (add a b) a) (mul (add a b) b)
  rw [add_mul, add_mul] -- distribute multiplication over addition
  rw [mul_comm b a] -- mul b a = mul a b
  rw [add_assoc, add_assoc] -- rearrange terms
  rw [← add_assoc (mul a a) (mul a b) (mul a b)] -- group terms
  rw [add_comm (mul a b) (mul b b)] -- swap terms
  rw [add_assoc (mul a a) (mul b b) (mul a b)] -- final grouping
  rw [pow_two, pow_two] -- mul a a = pow a two, mul b b = pow b two
  rw [← two_mul] -- add (mul a b) (mul a b) = mul two (mul a b)
  rw [mul_assoc] -- mul two (mul a b) = mul (mul two a) b
  rfl

name: le_antisymm
statement: theorem le_antisymm (x y : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyx : le y x) : x = y := by
proof:
theorem le_antisymm (x y : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyx : le y x) : x = y := by
  cases hxy with | intro c hc =>
  cases hyx with | intro d hd =>
  rw [hc] at hd
  rw [add_assoc] at hd
  have h : add d c = zero := by
    apply add_right_eq_self
    exact hd
  have hd_zero : d = zero := by
    apply add_right_eq_zero d c
    exact h
  have hc_zero : c = zero := by
    apply add_left_eq_zero d c
    exact h
  rw [hc_zero] at hc
  rw [hd_zero] at hd
  rw [add_zero] at hc
  rw [add_zero] at hd
  rw [hd] at hc
  exact hc

statement: theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
proof:
theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
  induction x with
  | zero =>
    left
    exact zero_le y
  | succ d ih =>
    cases ih with
    | inl hd_le_y =>
      cases hd_le_y with
      | intro c hc =>
        cases c with
        | zero =>
          right
          rw [hc, add_zero]
          exact le_succ_self d
        | succ k =>
          left
          use k
          rw [hc, add_succ, succ_add]
    | inr h_le_d =>
      right
      cases h_le_d with
      | intro c hc =>
        use succ c
        rw [hc, add_succ]

name: succ_le_succ
statement: theorem succ_le_succ (x y : MyNat) (hx : le (succ x) (succ y)) : le x y := by
proof:
theorem succ_le_succ (x y : MyNat) (hx : le (succ x) (succ y)) : le x y := by
  -- Unfold the definition of `le` in `hx` to get `c` such that `succ y = add (succ x) c`
  rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hx
  cases hx with | intro c hc =>
  -- Now we have `hc : succ y = add (succ x) c`
  -- Perform case analysis on `c`
  cases c with
  | zero =>
    -- Case `c = zero`
    rw [add_zero] at hc
    -- Now `hc : succ y = succ x`
    apply succ_inj at hc
    -- Now `hc : y = x`
    rw [le_iff_exists_add]
    use zero
    rw [add_zero]
    exact hc.symm
  | succ k =>
    -- Case `c = succ k`
    rw [add_succ] at hc
    -- Now `hc : succ y = succ (add (succ x) k)`
    apply succ_inj at hc
    -- Now `hc : y = add (succ x) k`
    rw [succ_add] at hc
    -- Now `hc : y = succ (add x k)`
    rw [le_iff_exists_add]
    use succ k
    rw [add_succ]
    exact hc.symm

name: le_one
statement: theorem le_one (x : MyNat) (hx : le x one) : x = zero ∨ x = one := by
proof:
theorem le_one (x : MyNat) (hx : le x one) : x = zero ∨ x = one := by
  cases hx with | intro c hc => 
  cases x with
  | zero => 
    left
    rfl
  | succ n => 
    right
    rw [add_succ] at hc
    have h : succ (add n c) = succ zero := by rw [← hc]
    have h' : add n c = zero := by apply succ_inj; exact h
    have hn : n = zero := by apply add_right_eq_zero; exact h'
    rw [hn]
    rfl

name: le_two
statement: theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
proof:
theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
  cases hx with | intro c hc =>
    induction x with
    | zero =>
      left
      rw [zero_add] at hc
      exact hc.symm
    | succ d ih =>
      rw [add_succ] at hc
      cases d with
      | zero =>
        right; left
        rw [zero_add] at hc
        apply succ_inj
        exact hc
      | succ k =>
        right; right
        rw [add_succ] at hc
        have h := succ_inj _ _ hc
        have h1 := add_right_eq_zero k c h
        rw [h1] at h
        rw [add_zero] at h
        rw [h]
        rfl

name: eq_succ_of_ne_zero
statement: theorem eq_succ_of_ne_zero (a : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) : ∃ n, a = succ n := by
proof:
theorem eq_succ_of_ne_zero (a : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) : ∃ n, a = succ n := by
  induction a with
  | zero =>
    contradiction
  | succ d =>
    use d
    rfl

name: one_le_of_ne_zero
statement: theorem one_le_of_ne_zero (a : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) : le one a := by
proof:
theorem one_le_of_ne_zero (a : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) : le one a := by
  -- Get n such that a = succ n
  cases eq_succ_of_ne_zero a ha with
  | intro n hn =>
    -- Rewrite a as succ n
    rw [hn]
    -- Rewrite succ n as add n one
    rw [succ_eq_add_one]
    -- Rewrite add n one as add one n
    rw [add_comm]
    -- Now a = add one n, so choose c = n
    use n
    rfl

name: le_mul_right
statement: theorem le_mul_right (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b ≠ zero) : le a (mul a b) := by
proof:
theorem le_mul_right (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b ≠ zero) : le a (mul a b) := by
  cases a with
  | zero =>
    -- Case a = zero leads to contradiction since mul zero b = zero
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    contradiction
  | succ a' =>
    -- Now a = succ a' ≠ zero
    have b_ne_zero : b ≠ zero := mul_left_ne_zero a b h
    cases eq_succ_of_ne_zero b b_ne_zero with
    | intro d hd =>
      -- b = succ d
      rw [hd, mul_succ]
      -- Goal: le (succ a') (add (mul (succ a') d) (succ a'))
      rw [add_comm]
      -- Now: le (succ a') (add (succ a') (mul (succ a') d))
      use mul (succ a') d
      rfl

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
  cases x with
  | zero =>
    rw [zero_mul] at h
    contradiction
  | succ n =>
    cases y with
    | zero =>
      rw [mul_zero] at h
      contradiction
    | succ m =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h
      have h_add : add (mul (succ n) m) (succ n) = one := h
      cases m with
      | zero =>
        rw [mul_zero] at h_add
        rw [add_zero] at h_add
        exact h_add
      | succ k =>
        rw [mul_succ] at h_add
        rw [add_assoc] at h_add
        have h_add_zero : add (add (mul (succ n) k) (succ n)) (succ n) = one := h_add
        have h_add_eq_zero : add (add (mul (succ n) k) (succ n)) (succ n) = zero := by
          apply add_right_eq_zero.1
          rw [h_add_zero]
          rw [one_eq_succ_zero]
          apply zero_ne_succ
        contradiction

name: mul_ne_zero
statement: theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by
proof:
theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by
  -- Express a as succ n since a ≠ zero
  cases (eq_succ_of_ne_zero a ha) with
  | intro n hn =>
    rw [hn]
    -- Now prove mul (succ n) b ≠ zero by induction on b
    induction b with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: b = zero contradicts hb
      contradiction
    | succ m ih =>
      -- Inductive step: use mul_succ and properties of addition
      rw [mul_succ]
      -- mul (succ n) (succ m) = add (mul (succ n) m) (succ n)
      -- Since succ n ≠ zero and ih says mul (succ n) m ≠ zero,
      -- the sum is a successor (hence not zero)
      intro h
      have h_add := add_right_eq_zero _ _ h
      rw [is_zero_succ] at h_add
      trivial

name: mul_eq_zero
statement: theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
proof:
theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
  induction a with
  | zero =>
    left
    rfl
  | succ n ih =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    have h1 := add_right_eq_zero _ _ h
    have h2 := add_left_eq_zero _ _ h
    cases h1 with
    | intro h_mul h_b =>
      right
      exact h_b
      -- Alternatively, we could use the inductive hypothesis here:
      -- cases ih h_mul with
      -- | inl hn => rw [hn] at h_b; right; exact h_b
      -- | inr hb => right; exact hb

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    -- Base case: b = zero
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    have hc := mul_eq_zero a c h
    cases hc with
    | inl hz => contradiction
    | inr hz => exact hz
  | succ d ih =>
    -- Inductive step: b = succ d
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    have hc : ∃ e, c = succ e := by
      contrapose! h
      cases c with
      | zero =>
        rw [mul_zero] at h
        exact ha (mul_eq_zero a (succ d) h).left
      | succ e =>
        contradiction
    cases hc with
    | intro e he =>
      rw [he, mul_succ] at h
      have h_add := add_right_cancel (mul a d) (mul a e) a h
      rw [ih h_add]
      rfl

name: mul_right_eq_self
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    -- Base case: b = zero
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    contradiction
  | succ d ih =>
    -- Inductive step: b = succ d
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    have h_add : add (mul a d) a = a := h
    rw [add_left_eq_self] at h_add
    have h_mul_zero : mul a d = zero := h_add
    rw [mul_eq_zero] at h_mul_zero
    cases h_mul_zero with
    | inl h_a_zero => contradiction
    | inr h_d_zero =>
      rw [h_d_zero]
      rfl
